text.author: Barney Ronay
text.description: The fracas over the Berlusconi vote is just the latest example of tempers fraying in debating chambers around the world
text.title: Politicians who don't pull their punches

main.p: Tuesday's victory for Silvio Berlusconi in a confidence vote in the Italian parliament was marked by brawling in the corridors of power as representatives in the Chamber of Deputies had to be separated by ushers. Although, as is often the case on these occasions, the actual fighting was just a bit disappointing. We asked former world super-middleweight champion Joe Calzaghe for his opinion of the Italian brawl and four other recent dust-ups – and he was largely unimpressed with the technique on show.

head.hi: Italy, December 2010. Berlusconi supporters brawl with members of the breakaway party formed by his former ally Gianfranco Fini

ref.hi: Graciela Camaño slaps colleague Carlos Kunkel

p.hi: Graciela Camaño slaps colleague Carlos Kunkel

main.p: You can see the menace in her eyes as she's building up to it. It's a lovely shot with really good accuracy right on the bridge of the nose. What she does well is move out quickly once she's got the punch away. She might have got a bit more power – it was more a slap – but these are hit-and-run tactics and she got her shot off well. I enjoyed that.

ref.hi: MPs throw eggs and grapple during a debate over the Russian naval presence in Crimea

p.hi: MPs throw eggs and grapple during a debate over the Russian naval presence in Crimea

main.p: I can't imagine this happening in the UK. You'd be taken down by Special Branch as soon as you got your eggs out. I was disappointed to see them holding on so much, but they fight a bit like the Klitschkos [Vladimir and Vitally, Ukrainian world champions]. There is only really one clean punch in there. It's an overhand, clubbing shot. A little bit sneaky, but sometimes it's got to be done.

ref.hi: MPs fight over a trade pact with China

p.hi: MPs fight over a trade pact with China

main.p: There's a lot of energy, but the execution of the shots is poor. It's a free-for-all. It's like going to a boxing match and the crowd are in the ring. They need to get their balance and take some proper shots. There's even a backhand punch. It's a girly shot.

ref.hi: Liberal Democratic party leader erupts over pro-Kremlin dominance in legislature

p.hi: Liberal Democratic party leader erupts over pro-Kremlin dominance in legislature

main.p: The man with the beard stays on his feet quite well. He's got decent footwork and there's some good work to the body just before he falls over. I think his jacket is holding him back a bit. He's half getting undressed, half trying to land a big right hand. But I can definitely see some talent. He's quite handy for a politician and looks like he might have been in a boxing ring.
